definition: to twist (strands into a thread)/to entangle/to wring/to hang (by the neck)/to turn/to wind/classifier for skeins of yarn
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia

sentences.english: Our grandmamas swung on them nooses.
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖母也被绞索绞死。

sentences.english: The protracted war turned into the hangman's noose on the neck of the US.
sentences.chinese: 战争久拖不决成为消耗美国的战略绞索。

sentences.english: Official video of the hanging shows Barzan being beheaded by the noose.
sentences.chinese: 官方录像显示被绞索斩首。

sentences.english: she happened to reach the end of the rope there.
sentences.chinese: 她恰巧在最后拉紧了绞索。

sentences.english: He had fashioned a noose out of our dog Grouper's leash.
sentences.chinese: 他用我们的狗古鲁普的皮带做了绞索。

sentences.english: He knew that it had a circle of black where the rope had bruised it.
sentences.chinese: 他知道，脖子上的黑圈是绞索勒出来的瘀伤。
我的脖子上套着二道绞索。

sentences.english: But only looked far wolhyang the noose tightened collectivisation in the executioner.
sentences.chinese: 但只能远远地看着月香惨死在刽子手收紧的绞索下。

sentences.english: Scythes, hips, and the hangman's noose all do it. Why not you?
sentences.chinese: 甩起镰刀扭起臀，夺命绞索荡悠悠，它们都行你也行。

definition: to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
